lead_paragraph: The law, which restricts transgender bathroom use and pre-empts local governments from creating anti-discrimination policies, reflects a split in a state known as moderate.

byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Raleigh, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: Bias Law Deepens Rifts in North Carolina
headline.main: Rights Law Deepens Political Rifts in North Carolina

snippet: The law, which restricts transgender bathroom use and pre-empts local governments from creating anti-discrimination policies, reflects a split in a state known as moderate.
abstract: North Carolina's divisive gay and transgender law has triggered protests led by Democrats opposing bill, with support of several corporations that have withdrawn lucrative business ventures from historically moderate state; clashes may end up affecting November elections, with possible shifts in Republican-controlled legislature and even Gov Pat McCrory's seat.
